display_asset.caption: The Finnish composer Kaija Saariaho.

summaries.body: The Metropolitan Opera is to stage its first opera by a woman since 1903. The 2016-17 season includes a work by the Finnish composer Kaija Saariaho.

display_asset.caption: The ancient fortress called Naryn-Kala, which dominates Derbent, Russia. Many in the town are convinced that the Kremlin lopped 3,000 years off Derbent’s age to avoid having a Muslim city named the oldest urban settlement in a country that presents itself as the defender of traditional Christian values.
display_asset.credit: James Hill for The New York Times

summaries.body: Derbent was planning to celebrate its 5,000th anniversary, claiming the title of Russia's oldest city. Then Moscow knocked 3,000 years off its age.

display_asset.caption: The radio telescope under construction in Guizhou Province. The building project, known as FAST, is estimated to cost about $184 million.

summaries.body: China is relocating thousands of villagers in Guizhou Province to build a $184 million telescope to detect signs of extraterrestrial life.

display_asset.caption: Steve Spagnuolo will remain the Giants’ defensive coordinator on Coach Ben McAdoo’s staff, which features familiar names.

summaries.body: The Giants announced that 12 assistant coaches from the former coach Tom Coughlin’s staff had been retained, including Steve Spagnuolo, the defensive coordinator.

display_asset.caption: Killer Mike at a rally for Bernie Sanders, a Democratic presidential candidate, in Atlanta.
display_asset.credit: Kevin D. Liles for The New York Times

summaries.body: Killer Mike, a rapper, ignited a controversy after he said that “a uterus doesn’t qualify you to be president” during an event hosted by Senator Bernie Sanders in Atlanta.
A report questions the authenticity of several brands of Parmesan cheese after it was found that one company’s “100 percent real” product was filled with wood pulp.
A man stole $26,000 from two women he met separately on Tinder, telling them he urgently needed to borrow money to pay medical bills for relatives.

display_asset.caption: Paul Aker of Houston said armed deputy marshals showed up at his door over an old student debt.

summaries.body: United States marshals showed up at the house of a Houston man who had failed to repay a $1,500 student loan that was almost 30 years old.

display_asset.caption: A scene from Marco Bellocchio’s Roman Inquisition piece, “Blood of My Blood.”

summaries.body: Retrospective period films continue to capture critics' imaginations, dominating the annual festival for Film Comment, the magazine of Lincoln Center's film society.

display_asset.caption: Manny Pacquiao, an eight-time world boxing champion who is running for senator in the Philippines, speaking to supporters in May.

summaries.body: Manny Pacquiao, the boxer turned Philippine politician, apologized after calling people in gay relationships "worse than animals."
Nigerian women and girls freed from Boko Haram are facing rejection when they return home, a report found, because of stigma about rape and fear of radicalization.

display_asset.credit: Matthew Staver for The New York Times

summaries.body: Levels of omega-3 fatty acids, beneficial for lowering the risk of heart disease, were 50 percent higher in organic meat and milk, a review of scientific studies reported.

display_asset.caption: Neel Kashkari was a Treasury Department official in the George W. Bush and Obama administrations.

summaries.body: A top architect of the 2008 federal bailout of the financial industry said "banks are still too big to fail" and that the government had not done enough to prevent a repeat.

display_asset.caption: Jesse Hughes, of the American band Eagles of Death Metal, in Stockholm on Saturday. “I can’t let the bad guys win,” he said.

summaries.body: Eagles of Death Metal are returning to Paris on Tuesday night for a concert honoring those who were killed in November during a performance by the American rock band.

display_asset.caption: Protesters with images of missing people — including Gui Minhai, third from left, and Lee Bo, second from right — in Hong Kong in January.

summaries.body: The United Nations’ top human rights official called on China to release a group of lawyers detained starting last summer.

display_asset.caption: Mary Lou Marzian, a Kentucky representative.

summaries.body: A state representative in Kentucky, seeking to make a point about restrictive abortion laws, has proposed a bill requiring men who want Viagra to get notes from their wives.
Four American journalists covering the anniversary of unrest in Bahrain were released after being charged with illegally assembling with the intent to commit a crime.

display_asset.caption: Dr. Bobbi Pritt, medical director of the Mayo Clinic lab where Borrelia mayonii, a new strain of bacteria causing Lyme disease, was first detected.
display_asset.credit: Mayo Foundation for Medical Education and Research

summaries.body: Researchers at the Mayo Clinic in Minnesota have discovered a new species of tick-borne bacteria that cause Lyme disease.
Sea levels aren’t rising as quickly as scientists expected because continents are absorbing water making its way to the sea, a study says.
The celebrity news organization TMZ is good at what it does. But is that journalism, or a combination of well-placed bribery and sleaze? Or all of the above?

display_asset.caption: The memorial will be cleaned and repaired, and educational space will be added beneath it.

summaries.body: The Lincoln Memorial will undergo an extensive renovation that will include cleaning, repairing earthquake damage and building space for educational programs.

display_asset.caption: The discovery of a corpse on Sunday led the Civil Aviation Authority of Zimbabwe to impound an American-owned cargo plane.

summaries.body: A body dripping blood was found along with a small fortune onboard a U.S. cargo jet that was refueling in Zimbabwe.

display_asset.caption: An official in Indonesia is pressuring instant messaging services to drop gay- and lesbian-themed emoticons.

summaries.body: A sudden onslaught of anti-gay speech is chipping away at the already fragile social standing of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people in Indonesia.

display_asset.caption: Passengers on a Hudson-Bergen Light Rail train as it passes through Jersey City.
display_asset.credit: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times

summaries.body: With Mayor Bill de Blasio proposing a streetcar line on the East River, city planners can look to a New Jersey train to assess the benefits of a similar system.

display_asset.caption: Gabe Freeman, a forward with the St. John Mill Rats of the National Basketball League of Canada, after the team’s bus broke down on the way to a game last month. “You think professional basketball is all peaches and cream until you actually get here,” he said.
display_asset.credit: Michelle Siu for The New York Times

summaries.body: In Canada’s National Basketball League, the pros forgo nine-figure contracts in favor of bus rides in blizzards, budget hotels, and $30 per diems.

display_asset.caption: Marc Blumencranz, center, an insurance broker who competed in the 2013 Ironman Triathlon World Championships in Kailua-Kona, Hawaii, training last month in Brookville, N.Y.
display_asset.credit: Yana Paskova for The New York Times

summaries.body: They may be in it for their health and some kicks, but amateur Ironman competitors can pay hundreds of thousands for travel, trainers and more.
While a set of Kim Kardashian emojis, called Kimojis, is among the top selling apps, another designer has released free emojis inspired by Kim Jong-un, called Kimunjis.
To keep Oscar acceptance speeches from being merely a list of names, producers are asking nominees for advance thank-you lists that could scroll across the screen.

display_asset.caption: Kanye West and Taylor Swift at the 2015 Grammy Awards.

summaries.body: The Kanye West-Taylor Swift feud appears on again after Mr. West released a new song with a couple of crass references to Ms. Swift, which she may or may not have approved.

display_asset.caption: A red-tailed hawk photographed during the Great Backyard Bird Count in 2015.
display_asset.credit: Peter Ferguson/Courtesy Cornell Lab of Ornithology

summaries.body: The Great Backyard Bird Count is upon us this weekend; last year, more than 140,000 people from over 100 countries classified nearly half of the world’s bird types.
